00041 static command_t * top_level;           /* Top level of commands, initialized by
00042                                     * InitParser                              */
00043 static char * parser_prompt = NULL;/* Parser prompt, set by InitParser      */
00044 static int done;                   /* Set to 1 if user types exit or quit   */
00045 static int ignore_errors;       /* Normally, the parser will quit when
00046                                    an error occurs in non-interacive
00047                                    mode. Setting this to non-zero will
00048                                    force it to keep buggering on. */

00051 /* static functions */
00052 static char *skipwhitespace(char *s);
00053 static char *skiptowhitespace(char *s);
00054 static command_t *find_cmd(char *name, command_t cmds[], char **next);
00055 static int process(char *s, char **next, command_t *lookup, command_t **result,
00056                    char **prev);
00057 static void print_commands(char *str, command_t *table);
00058 
00059 static char * skipwhitespace(char * s)
00060 {
00061         char * t;
00062         int    len;
00063 
00064         len = (int)strlen(s);
00065         for (t = s; t <= s + len && isspace(*t); t++);
00066         return(t);
00067 }
00068 
00069 
00070 static char * skiptowhitespace(char * s)
00071 {
00072         char * t;
00073 
00074         for (t = s; *t && !isspace(*t); t++);
00075         return(t);
00076 }
00077 
00078 static int line2args(char *line, char **argv, int maxargs)
00079 {
00080         char *arg;
00081         int i = 0;
00082 
00083         arg = strtok(line, " \t");
00084         if (arg == NULL || maxargs < 1)
00085                 return 0;
00086 
00087         argv[i++] = arg;
00088         while ((arg = strtok(NULL, " \t")) != NULL && i < maxargs)
00089                 argv[i++] = arg;
00090         return i;
00091 }
00092 
00093 /* find a command -- return it if unique otherwise print alternatives */
00094 static command_t *Parser_findargcmd(char *name, command_t cmds[])
00095 {
00096         command_t *cmd;
00097 
00098         for (cmd = cmds; cmd->pc_name; cmd++) {
00099                 if (strcmp(name, cmd->pc_name) == 0)
00100                         return cmd;
00101         }
00102         return NULL;
00103 }

00105 void Parser_ignore_errors(int ignore)
00106 {
00107         ignore_errors = ignore;
00108 }

00110 int Parser_execarg(int argc, char **argv, command_t cmds[])
00111 {
00112         command_t *cmd;
00113 
00114         cmd = Parser_findargcmd(argv[0], cmds);
00115         if ( cmd ) {
00116                 int rc = (cmd->pc_func)(argc, argv);
00117                 if (rc == CMD_HELP)
00118                         fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", cmd->pc_help);
00119                 return rc;
00120         } else {
00121                 printf("Try interactive use without arguments or use one of:\n");
00122                 for (cmd = cmds; cmd->pc_name; cmd++)
00123                         printf("\"%s\"\n", cmd->pc_name);
00124                 printf("as argument.\n");
00125         }
00126         return -1;
00127 }
00128 
00129 /* returns the command_t * (NULL if not found) corresponding to a
00130    _partial_ match with the first token in name.  It sets *next to
00131    point to the following token. Does not modify *name. */
00132 static command_t * find_cmd(char * name, command_t cmds[], char ** next)
00133 {
00134         int    i, len;
00135 
00136         if (!cmds || !name )
00137                 return NULL;
00138 
00139         /* This sets name to point to the first non-white space character,
00140            and next to the first whitespace after name, len to the length: do
00141            this with strtok*/
00142         name = skipwhitespace(name);
00143         *next = skiptowhitespace(name);
00144         len = (int)(*next - name);
00145         if (len == 0)
00146                 return NULL;
00147 
00148         for (i = 0; cmds[i].pc_name; i++) {
00149                 if (strncasecmp(name, cmds[i].pc_name, len) == 0) {
00150                         *next = skipwhitespace(*next);
00151                         return(&cmds[i]);
00152                 }
00153         }
00154         return NULL;
00155 }
00156 
00157 /* Recursively process a command line string s and find the command
00158    corresponding to it. This can be ambiguous, full, incomplete,
00159    non-existent. */
00160 static int process(char *s, char ** next, command_t *lookup,
00161                    command_t **result, char **prev)
00162 {
00163         *result = find_cmd(s, lookup, next);
00164         *prev = s;
00165 
00166         /* non existent */
00167         if (!*result)
00168                 return CMD_NONE;
00169 
00170         /* found entry: is it ambigous, i.e. not exact command name and
00171            more than one command in the list matches.  Note that find_cmd
00172            points to the first ambiguous entry */
00173         if (strncasecmp(s, (*result)->pc_name, strlen((*result)->pc_name))) {
00174                 char *another_next;
00175                 command_t *another_result = find_cmd(s, (*result) + 1,
00176                                                      &another_next);
00177                 int found_another = 0;
00178 
00179                 while (another_result) {
00180                         if (strncasecmp(s, another_result->pc_name,
00181                                         strlen(another_result->pc_name)) == 0){
00182                                 *result = another_result;
00183                                 *next = another_next;
00184                                 goto got_it;
00185                         }
00186                         another_result = find_cmd(s, another_result + 1,
00187                                                   &another_next);
00188                         found_another = 1;
00189                 }
00190                 if (found_another)
00191                         return CMD_AMBIG;
00192         }
00193 
00194 got_it:
00195         /* found a unique command: component or full? */
00196         if ( (*result)->pc_func ) {
00197                 return CMD_COMPLETE;
00198         } else {
00199                 if ( *next == '\0' ) {
00200                         return CMD_INCOMPLETE;
00201                 } else {
00202                         return process(*next, next, (*result)->pc_sub_cmd,
00203                                        result, prev);
00204                 }
00205         }
00206 }
00207 
00208 #ifdef HAVE_LIBREADLINE
00209 static command_t * match_tbl;   /* Command completion against this table */
00210 static char * command_generator(const char * text, int state)
00211 {
00212         static int index,
00213                 len;
00214         char       *name;
00215 
00216         /* Do we have a match table? */
00217         if (!match_tbl)
00218                 return NULL;
00219 
00220         /* If this is the first time called on this word, state is 0 */
00221         if (!state) {
00222                 index = 0;
00223                 len = (int)strlen(text);
00224         }
00225 
00226         /* Return next name in the command list that paritally matches test */
00227         while ( (name = (match_tbl + index)->pc_name) ) {
00228                 index++;
00229 
00230                 if (strncasecmp(name, text, len) == 0) {
00231                         return(strdup(name));
00232                 }
00233         }
00234 
00235         /* No more matches */
00236         return NULL;
00237 }
00238 
00239 /* probably called by readline */
00240 static char **command_completion(const char *text, int start, int end)
00241 {
00242         command_t   * table;
00243         char        * pos;
00244 
00245         match_tbl = top_level;
00246         
00247         for (table = find_cmd(rl_line_buffer, match_tbl, &pos);
00248              table; table = find_cmd(pos, match_tbl, &pos)) 
00249         {
00250 
00251                 if (*(pos - 1) == ' ') match_tbl = table->pc_sub_cmd;
00252         }
00253 
00254         return rl_completion_matches(text, command_generator);
00255 }
00256 #endif
00257 
00258 /* take a string and execute the function or print help */
00259 int execute_line(char * line)
00260 {
00261         command_t       *cmd, *ambig;
00262         char            *prev;
00263         char            *next, *tmp;
00264         char            *argv[MAXARGS];
00265         int             i;
00266         int             rc = 0;
00267 
00268         switch (process(line, &next, top_level, &cmd, &prev)) {
00269         case CMD_AMBIG:
00270                 fprintf(stderr, "Ambiguous command \'%s\'\nOptions: ", line);
00271                 while ((ambig = find_cmd(prev, cmd, &tmp))) {
00272                         fprintf(stderr, "%s ", ambig->pc_name);
00273                         cmd = ambig + 1;
00274                 }
00275                 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00276                 break;
00277         case CMD_NONE:
00278                 fprintf(stderr, "No such command, type help\n");
00279                 break;
00280         case CMD_INCOMPLETE:
00281                 fprintf(stderr, "'%s' incomplete command.  Use '%s x' where "
00282                         "x is one of:\n", line, line);
00283                 fprintf(stderr, "\t");
00284                 for (i = 0; cmd->pc_sub_cmd[i].pc_name; i++)
00285                         fprintf(stderr, "%s ", cmd->pc_sub_cmd[i].pc_name);
00286                 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00287                 break;
00288         case CMD_COMPLETE:
00289                 optind = 0;
00290                 i = line2args(line, argv, MAXARGS);
00291                 rc = (cmd->pc_func)(i, argv);
00292 
00293                 if (rc == CMD_HELP)
00294                         fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", cmd->pc_help);
00295 
00296                 break;
00297         }
00298 
00299         return rc;
00300 }

00302 #ifdef HAVE_LIBREADLINE
00303 static void noop_int_fn(int unused) { }
00304 static void noop_void_fn(void) { }
00305 #endif
00306 
00307 /* just in case you're ever in an airplane and discover you
00308  * forgot to install readline-dev. :) */
00309 static int init_input(void)
00310 {
00311         int interactive = isatty(fileno(stdin));
00312 
00313 #ifdef HAVE_LIBREADLINE
00314         using_history();
00315         stifle_history(HISTORY);
00316 
00317         if (!interactive) {
00318                 rl_prep_term_function = noop_int_fn;
00319                 rl_deprep_term_function = noop_void_fn;
00320         }
00321 
00322         rl_attempted_completion_function = command_completion;
00323         rl_completion_entry_function = command_generator;
00324 #endif
00325         return interactive;
00326 }
00327 
00328 #ifndef HAVE_LIBREADLINE
00329 #define add_history(s)
00330 char * readline(char * prompt)
00331 {
00332         int size = 2048;
00333         char *line = malloc(size);
00334         char *ptr = line;
00335         int c;
00336         int eof = 0;
00337 
00338         if (line == NULL)
00339                 return NULL;
00340         if (prompt)
00341                 printf ("%s", prompt);
00342 
00343         while (1) {
00344                 if ((c = fgetc(stdin)) != EOF) {
00345                         if (c == '\n')
00346                                 goto out;
00347                         *ptr++ = (char)c;
00348 
00349                         if (ptr - line >= size - 1) {
00350                                 char *tmp;
00351 
00352                                 size *= 2;
00353                                 tmp = malloc(size);
00354                                 if (tmp == NULL)
00355                                         goto outfree;
00356                                 memcpy(tmp, line, ptr - line);
00357                                 ptr = tmp + (ptr - line);
00358                                 free(line);
00359                                 line = tmp;
00360                         }
00361                 } else {
00362                         eof = 1;
00363                         if (ferror(stdin) || feof(stdin))
00364                                 goto outfree;
00365                         goto out;
00366                 }
00367         }
00368 out:
00369         *ptr = 0;
00370         if (eof && (strlen(line) == 0)) {
00371                 free(line);
00372                 line = NULL;
00373         }
00374         return line;
00375 outfree:
00376         free(line);
00377         return NULL;
00378 }
00379 #endif
00380 
00381 /* this is the command execution machine */
00382 int Parser_commands(void)
00383 {
00384         char *line, *s;
00385         int rc = 0, save_error = 0;
00386         int interactive;
00387 
00388         interactive = init_input();
00389 
00390         while(!done) {
00391                 line = readline(interactive ? parser_prompt : NULL);
00392 
00393                 if (!line) break;
00394 
00395                 s = skipwhitespace(line);
00396 
00397                 if (*s) {
00398                         add_history(s);
00399                         rc = execute_line(s);
00400                 }
00401                 /* stop on error if not-interactive */
00402                 if (rc != 0 && !interactive) {
00403                         if (save_error == 0)
00404                                 save_error = rc;
00405                         if (!ignore_errors)
00406                                 done = 1;
00407                 }
00408 
00409                 free(line);
00410         }
00411         if (save_error)
00412                 rc = save_error;
00413         return rc;
00414 }
00415

00417 /* sets the parser prompt */
00418 void Parser_init(char * prompt, command_t * cmds)
00419 {
00420         done = 0;
00421         top_level = cmds;
00422         if (parser_prompt) free(parser_prompt);
00423         parser_prompt = strdup(prompt);
00424 }
00425 
00426 /* frees the parser prompt */
00427 void Parser_exit(int argc, char *argv[])
00428 {
00429         done = 1;
00430         free(parser_prompt);
00431         parser_prompt = NULL;
00432 }
00433 
00434 /* convert a string to an integer */
00435 int Parser_int(char *s, int *val)
00436 {
00437         int ret;
00438 
00439         if (*s != '0')
00440                 ret = sscanf(s, "%d", val);
00441         else if (*(s+1) != 'x')
00442                 ret = sscanf(s, "%o", val);
00443         else {
00444                 s++;
00445                 ret = sscanf(++s, "%x", val);
00446         }
00447 
00448         return(ret);
00449 }

00452 void Parser_qhelp(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00453 
00454         printf("Available commands are:\n");
00455 
00456         print_commands(NULL, top_level);
00457         printf("For more help type: help command-name\n");
00458 }
00459 
00460 int Parser_help(int argc, char **argv)
00461 {
00462         char line[1024];
00463         char *next, *prev, *tmp;
00464         command_t *result, *ambig;
00465         int i;
00466 
00467         if ( argc == 1 ) {
00468                 Parser_qhelp(argc, argv);
00469                 return 0;
00470         }
00471 
00472         /* Joining command line arguments without space is not critical here
00473          * because of this string is used for search a help topic and assume
00474          * that only one argument will be (the name of topic). For example:
00475          * lst > help ping run
00476          * pingrun: Unknown command. */
00477         line[0] = '\0';
00478         for (i = 1;  i < argc; i++) {
00479                 if (strlen(argv[i]) >= sizeof(line) - strlen(line))
00480                         return -E2BIG;
00481                 /* The function strlcat() cannot be used here because of
00482                  * this function is used in LNet utils that is not linked
00483                  * with libcfs.a. */
00484                 strncat(line, argv[i], sizeof(line) - strlen(line));
00485         }
00486 
00487         switch ( process(line, &next, top_level, &result, &prev) ) {
00488         case CMD_COMPLETE:
00489                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n",line, result->pc_help);
00490                 break;
00491         case CMD_NONE:
00492                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unknown command.\n", line);
00493                 break;
00494         case CMD_INCOMPLETE:
00495                 fprintf(stderr,
00496                         "'%s' incomplete command.  Use '%s x' where x is one of:\n",
00497                         line, line);
00498                 fprintf(stderr, "\t");
00499                 for (i = 0; result->pc_sub_cmd[i].pc_name; i++) {
00500                         fprintf(stderr, "%s ", result->pc_sub_cmd[i].pc_name);
00501                 }
00502                 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00503                 break;
00504         case CMD_AMBIG:
00505                 fprintf(stderr, "Ambiguous command \'%s\'\nOptions: ", line);
00506                 while( (ambig = find_cmd(prev, result, &tmp)) ) {
00507                         fprintf(stderr, "%s ", ambig->pc_name);
00508                         result = ambig + 1;
00509                 }
00510                 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00511                 break;
00512         }
00513         return 0;
00514 }
00515 
00516 
00517 void Parser_printhelp(char *cmd)
00518 {
00519         char *argv[] = { "help", cmd };
00520         Parser_help(2, argv);
00521 }

00524 /*************************************************************************
00525  * COMMANDS                                                              *
00526  *************************************************************************/
00527 static void print_commands(char * str, command_t * table) {
00528         command_t * cmds;
00529         char         buf[80];
00530 
00531         for (cmds = table; cmds->pc_name; cmds++) {
00532                 if (cmds->pc_func) {
00533                         if (str) printf("\t%s %s\n", str, cmds->pc_name);
00534                         else printf("\t%s\n", cmds->pc_name);
00535                 }
00536                 if (cmds->pc_sub_cmd) {
00537                         if (str) {
00538                                 sprintf(buf, "%s %s", str, cmds->pc_name);
00539                                 print_commands(buf, cmds->pc_sub_cmd);
00540                         } else {
00541                                 print_commands(cmds->pc_name, cmds->pc_sub_cmd);
00542                         }
00543                 }
00544         }
00545 }
00546 
00547 char *Parser_getstr(const char *prompt, const char *deft, char *res,
00548                     size_t len)
00549 {
00550         char *line = NULL;
00551         int size = strlen(prompt) + strlen(deft) + 8;
00552         char *theprompt;
00553         theprompt = malloc(size);
00554         assert(theprompt);
00555 
00556         sprintf(theprompt, "%s [%s]: ", prompt, deft);
00557 
00558         line  = readline(theprompt);
00559         free(theprompt);
00560 
00561         /* The function strlcpy() cannot be used here because of
00562          * this function is used in LNet utils that is not linked
00563          * with libcfs.a. */
00564         if (line == NULL || *line == '\0')
00565                 strncpy(res, deft, len);
00566         else
00567                 strncpy(res, line, len);
00568         res[len - 1] = '\0';
00569 
00570         if (line != NULL) {
00571                 free(line);
00572                 return res;
00573         }
00574         return NULL;
00575 }
00576 
00577 /* get integer from prompt, loop forever to get it */
00578 int Parser_getint(const char *prompt, long min, long max, long deft, int base)
00579 {
00580         int rc;
00581         long result;
00582         char *line;
00583         int size = strlen(prompt) + 40;
00584         char *theprompt = malloc(size);
00585         assert(theprompt);
00586         sprintf(theprompt,"%s [%ld, (0x%lx)]: ", prompt, deft, deft);
00587 
00588         fflush(stdout);
00589 
00590         do {
00591                 line = NULL;
00592                 line = readline(theprompt);
00593                 if ( !line ) {
00594                         fprintf(stdout, "Please enter an integer.\n");
00595                         fflush(stdout);
00596                         continue;
00597                 }
00598                 if ( *line == '\0' ) {
00599                         free(line);
00600                         result =  deft;
00601                         break;
00602                 }
00603                 rc = Parser_arg2int(line, &result, base);
00604                 free(line);
00605                 if ( rc != 0 ) {
00606                         fprintf(stdout, "Invalid string.\n");
00607                         fflush(stdout);
00608                 } else if ( result > max || result < min ) {
00609                         fprintf(stdout, "Error: response must lie between %ld and %ld.\n",
00610                                 min, max);
00611                         fflush(stdout);
00612                 } else {
00613                         break;
00614                 }
00615         } while ( 1 ) ;
00616 
00617         if (theprompt)
00618                 free(theprompt);
00619         return result;
00620 
00621 }
00622 
00623 /* get boolean (starting with YyNn; loop forever */
00624 int Parser_getbool(const char *prompt, int deft)
00625 {
00626         int result = 0;
00627         char *line;
00628         int size = strlen(prompt) + 8;
00629         char *theprompt = malloc(size);
00630         assert(theprompt);
00631 
00632         fflush(stdout);
00633 
00634         if ( deft != 0 && deft != 1 ) {
00635                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Parser_getbool given bad default %d\n",
00636                         deft);
00637                 assert ( 0 );
00638         }
00639         sprintf(theprompt, "%s [%s]: ", prompt, (deft==0)? "N" : "Y");
00640 
00641         do {
00642                 line = NULL;
00643                 line = readline(theprompt);
00644                 if ( line == NULL ) {
00645                         result = deft;
00646                         break;
00647                 }
00648                 if ( *line == '\0' ) {
00649                         result = deft;
00650                         break;
00651                 }
00652                 if ( *line == 'y' || *line == 'Y' ) {
00653                         result = 1;
00654                         break;
00655                 }
00656                 if ( *line == 'n' || *line == 'N' ) {
00657                         result = 0;
00658                         break;
00659                 }
00660                 if ( line )
00661                         free(line);
00662                 fprintf(stdout, "Invalid string. Must start with yY or nN\n");
00663                 fflush(stdout);
00664         } while ( 1 );
00665 
00666         if ( line )
00667                 free(line);
00668         if ( theprompt )
00669                 free(theprompt);
00670         return result;
00671 }
00672 
00673 /* parse int out of a string or prompt for it */
00674 long Parser_intarg(const char *inp, const char *prompt, int deft,
00675                    int min, int max, int base)
00676 {
00677         long result;
00678         int rc;
00679 
00680         rc = Parser_arg2int(inp, &result, base);
00681 
00682         if ( rc == 0 ) {
00683                 return result;
00684         } else {
00685                 return Parser_getint(prompt, deft, min, max, base);
00686         }
00687 }
00688 
00689 /* parse int out of a string or prompt for it */
00690 char *Parser_strarg(char *inp, const char *prompt, const char *deft,
00691                     char *answer, int len)
00692 {
00693         if ( inp == NULL || *inp == '\0' ) {
00694                 return Parser_getstr(prompt, deft, answer, len);
00695         } else
00696                 return inp;
00697 }
00698 
00699 /* change a string into a number: return 0 on success. No invalid characters
00700    allowed. The processing of base and validity follows strtol(3)*/
00701 int Parser_arg2int(const char *inp, long *result, int base)
00702 {
00703         char *endptr;
00704 
00705         if ( (base !=0) && (base < 2 || base > 36) )
00706                 return 1;
00707 
00708         *result = strtol(inp, &endptr, base);
00709 
00710         if ( *inp != '\0' && *endptr == '\0' )
00711                 return 0;
00712         else
00713                 return 1;
00714 }
00715 
00716 /* Convert human readable size string to and int; "1k" -> 1000 */
00717 int Parser_size (int *sizep, char *str) {
00718         int size;
00719         char mod[32];
00720 
00721         switch (sscanf (str, "%d%1[gGmMkK]", &size, mod)) {
00722         default:
00723                 return (-1);
00724 
00725         case 1:
00726                 *sizep = size;
00727                 return (0);
00728 
00729         case 2:
00730                 switch (*mod) {
00731                 case 'g':
00732                 case 'G':
00733                         *sizep = size << 30;
00734                         return (0);
00735 
00736                 case 'm':
00737                 case 'M':
00738                         *sizep = size << 20;
00739                         return (0);
00740 
00741                 case 'k':
00742                 case 'K':
00743                         *sizep = size << 10;
00744                         return (0);
00745 
00746                 default:
00747                         *sizep = size;
00748                         return (0);
00749                 }
00750         }
00751 }
00752 
00753 /* Convert a string boolean to an int; "enable" -> 1 */
00754 int Parser_bool (int *b, char *str) {
00755         if (!strcasecmp (str, "no") ||
00756             !strcasecmp (str, "n") ||
00757             !strcasecmp (str, "off") ||
00758             !strcasecmp (str, "down") ||
00759             !strcasecmp (str, "disable"))
00760         {
00761                 *b = 0;
00762                 return (0);
00763         }
00764 
00765         if (!strcasecmp (str, "yes") ||
00766             !strcasecmp (str, "y") ||
00767             !strcasecmp (str, "on") ||
00768             !strcasecmp (str, "up") ||
00769             !strcasecmp (str, "enable"))
00770         {
00771                 *b = 1;
00772                 return (0);
00773         }
00774 
00775         return (-1);
00776 }
00777 
00778 int Parser_quit(int argc, char **argv)
00779 {
00780         argc = argc;
00781         argv = argv;
00782         done = 1;
00783         return 0;
00784 }
00785 
00786 int Parser_version(int argc, char **argv)
00787 {
00788         fprintf(stdout, "%s %s\n", program_invocation_short_name,
00789                 LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
00790         return 0;
00791 }
